N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6659.7 - Claims for State aid

State Regulations
(a) A municipality receiving $2,460 or less
in State aid shall submit a claim for reimbursement at the end of its program
period, or more frequently if desired. (b) A municipality receiving more than $2,460
in State aid shall submit a claim for reimbursement at least
semiannually. (c) Each such claim
for reimbursement shall be in a form prescribed by the director. At a minimum, such forms must be submitted in duplicate and shall include the following
information: (1)
the name and address of the
municipality or municipalities sponsoring the recreation program; (2)
the program period; (3)
the period of expenditure for which funds
are being requested; (4)
the total
amount of funds expended; and
(5)
the original signature of the municipal official authorized to receive payment
certifying that the municipality has expended recreation funds in accordance
with the terms of the approved application and with the recreation program for
the elderly law and regulations. In addition, applications for reimbursement
for municipalities receiving $1,000 or more in State aid must include: a State
aid voucher continuation sheet listing all expenditures eligible for
reimbursement; two copies of the municipal voucher for all bus trips; and, two
copies of the municipal voucher for all items of expense exceeding
$200. (d) Where two or
more municipalities join together as provided in section
6659.5
(c) of this

Part, each municipality shall submit a separate application for reimbursement
as provided under subdivisions (a), (b), (c) and (e) of this section, and which
shall set forth such municipality's proportionate share of expenditures
made. (e) All reimbursement claims
must be submitted to the State Office for the Aging not later than 60 days
after the close of the program period. (f) The director may authorize or direct the

State Comptroller to withhold payment of State aid for a recreation program for
the elderly to a municipality which alters or discontinues an approved
recreation program or which fails to comply with these regulations. Notes
